ingredients: 1 (1 pound) pork tenderloin cut into 1-inch thick slices
instructions: In a resealable plastic bag, combine the garlic, marjoram, thyme, salt and onion powder.
Add meat, a slice at a time; shake to coat evenly.
In a nonstick skillet, cook meat in butter over medium heat for 2-3 minutes on each side or until meat is no longer pink.
Add syrup to meat in skillet.
Cook over medium-high heat, turning several times, for about 3 minutes or until syrup is absorbed.
title: Maple Pork Slices

normalized_ingredients.IncVS739S: pork tenderloin cut into 1-inch thick slices

steps: Flatten meat to 1/2-in. thickness. In a resealable plastic bag, combine the garlic, marjoram, thyme, salt and onion powder. Add meat, a slice at a time; shake to coat evenly. In a nonstick skillet, cook meat in butter over medium heat for 2-3 minutes on each side or until meat is no longer pink. Drain and discard pan juices. Add syrup to meat in skillet. Cook over medium-high heat, turning several times, for about 3 minutes or until syrup is absorbed. Serve immediately.
